image.altText: Noemie Fox

props.synopsis: Noémie Fox storms to victory in the women's kayak cross final, as Jack Robinson makes the surfing final and Armand Duplantis breaks the pole vault record. Follow live.

title.children: Tears flow as Noémie Fox wins kayak cross to join sister Jess as a gold medallist, as Robinson makes surfing final

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's Jack Robinson is into the men's surfing final!
Athletics: Gold medallist Duplantis breaks world record!

image.altText: Jess Fox hugs Noemie Fox's face from in the water

props.synopsis: Fox sisters sweep the canoe slalom medals in Vaires-sur-Marne, with Noémie stepping out of Jess's enormous shadow to claim a joyful gold medal.

title.children: Jess Fox leapt into the water to salute her sister Noémie, so often in the shadow, now with a golden lustre all of her own

image.altText: a young woman with dark brown hair wearing a lanyard

props.synopsis: Lena Rennick has fallen in love with Alice Springs since moving there with her young family last year. But there are concerns fears about crime and a lack of incentives are deterring young doctors from moving to the region.

title.children: Lena moved to Alice Springs to work as a GP. The NT needs 80 doctors to do the same

image.altText: A bald man wearing a black shirt holds a surfboard in the front yard of a brick house.

props.synopsis: The number of homes resold in less than three years has jumped to its highest level in at least a decade, according to figures from CoreLogic. It could be indicative of more borrowers choosing to sell their homes before falling too far behind on their repayments.

title.children: Why mortgage borrowers are defaulting on other bills before missing their repayments

image.altText: RBA reno 2

props.synopsis: What a difference a week can make. Just days ago, there were growing calls for the RBA to hike rates once more. Now that's effectively off the table, financial markets are in a mad panic that rate cuts won't come soon enough.

title.children: The RBA has managed to dodge a bullet on interest rates, but dark economic clouds are looming

image.altText: Sheikh Hasina speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Bangladeshi prime minister Sheikh Hasina has resigned and fled the country after weeks of deadly protests.

title.children: Bangladesh PM resigns after month of protests

image.altText: A man in a suit stands in front of a flag.

props.synopsis: The head of ASIO says the targeting of Australia's youth and the rise of a violent mix of ideologies that defy logic are among the major reasons Australia's terror threat has been raised.

title.children: Young Australians falling down a 'rabbit hole of hate', ASIO boss warns

image.altText: Police commissioner hugs indigenous woman after apologising for NT police failure

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner's historic apology at Garma has been cautiously welcomed by Aboriginal peak bodies, but it's deepened the rift between the police union and the executive.

title.children: NT police commissioner's Garma apology hailed as a 'new dawning'

image.altText: Nina Kennedy smiles at the camera after the pole vault at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Nina Kennedy reaches the Paris Olympics pole vault final after a chaotic qualifying round that left two British stars in tears. Meanwhile, Matt Denny powers into the discus final and teenager Torrie Lewis wins at the Olympics for the first time.

title.children: 'You have to respect the process': Nina Kennedy shrugs off fellow world champion's qualifying blunder

image.altText: Simone Biles in action mid air as she leaps during a floor routine

props.synopsis: Simone Biles suffered a defeat in the floor exercise final at the Paris Olympics after two errors allowed Brazilian gymnast Rebeca Andrade to snatch an unexpected gold medal.

title.children: Simone Biles upstaged by Brazil's Rebeca Andrade in floor final

image.altText: On a purple background a woman in greyscale wears a read helmet and boxing gloves. Beside her a figure in red and 1 in blue box

props.synopsis: What started as athletes attempting to compete in their chosen sport has spiralled into a story that now involves a Russia-linked official, a global social media pile-on, huge amounts of mis- and disinformation and anti-trans activists jumping in.

title.children: Why has Olympic women's boxing become the latest punching bag in the anti-trans war?

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks at a podium in front of Australian and US flags.

props.synopsis: Australians will soon be eligible for easier passage through American airports as participation in the US Global Entry program is set to begin early next year.

title.children: Australian travellers to US to get access to airport shortcut program

image.altText: The colourful Google logo against a white wall.

props.synopsis: A US judge says "Google is a monopolist" that pays billions to keep competitors off smartphones and browsers.

title.children: Google broke law with monopoly on search, court rules

image.altText: View of a palm tree-lined road with a yellow middle strip in California leading into the horizon.

props.synopsis: California, known for palm tree-lined boulevards and the iconic Hollywood hills, is adding another claim to fame: renewable energy. And the Golden State could offer a glimpse into the crystal ball of Australia's energy future.

title.children: In California, big batteries are eating into gas demand, showing how Australia could harness its solar power glut

image.altText: A close up of a man's face

props.synopsis: After intense rainfall in Kerala's hilly district, torrents of mud and rocks swept people to their deaths as they slept. Sahir Edathodi lost 25 family members in the disaster.

title.children: More than half a metre of rain fell on Kerala in 48 hours. Then, 86,000 square metres of land shifted

image.altText: A man sits wearing glasses and a green jacket with a T-shirt featuring The Simpsons just seen underneath

props.synopsis: A former Chinese spy is set to give evidence in a major Canadian inquiry into foreign interference following his appearance on Four Corners, where he revealed China's illegal operations on foreign soil, including the targeting of a prominent dissident who died in Canada in 2022.

title.children: Former Chinese spy who appeared on Four Corners set to testify at Canadian foreign interference inquiry

image.altText: Nick looking at son

props.synopsis: A proposal for a tiered approach to NDIS provider registration based on risk has been cautiously welcomed by a number of disability advocates.

title.children: 'There's more regulation for pouring a beer': Attention turns to the next phase of complex NDIS reform

image.altText: High-rise apartments in a city

props.synopsis: Scientists studying 30 years of satellite data find it is no longer just megacities such as New York, Tokyo and Shanghai that are reaching for the sky.

title.children: Three decades of satellite imagery reveals our cities are growing up

image.altText: Birds eye view of a neighbourhood litttered with homes and buildings

props.synopsis: Police say the pilot was killed when separatist rebels rounded up those on board the helicopter when it landed in an isolated area.

title.children: Police say New Zealand helicopter pilot killed by Indonesian rebels

image.altText: Melissa Wu holding her legs midway through her dive in the 10-metre platform semifinal.

props.synopsis: Half a lifetime since becoming an Olympic teenage sensation, Melissa Wu plunges into the record books again by diving for Australia in a record five Games — and reaching a fifth 10-metre platform final.

title.children: Melissa Wu defies odds to reach 10m platform final in record fifth Olympics

image.altText: Keir Starmer stands at a podium, with two British flags in the background.

props.synopsis: British prime minister Keir Starmer has announced that a "standing army" of specialist police will be deployed in response to riots across the country.

title.children: Britain's prime minister to introduce 'standing army' of specialist police after riots

image.altText: Four people walk along a footpath in front of the ASX building on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: After experiencing what analysts call a "Goldilocks scenario", Australian stocks just suffered their biggest fall since the pandemic lockdown era and global financial markets are nervous.

title.children: Australia's 'Goldilocks scenario' is over with a $100 billion fall. It's hard to tell what happens now

image.altText: Four men walking with their backs to the camera.

props.synopsis: A Victorian prison program is helping inmates prepare for life on the outside by setting them up with the skills and set routine to find careers in the dairy industry.

title.children: A home, a career, and a fresh start. These prisoners are finding freedom through farming

image.altText: A person in a colourful boilersuit gtalks into a microphone in the spotlight of a darkened stage.

props.synopsis: Burnt out and struggling ahead of MICF, Scout Boxall did the unthinkable and cancelled their season. Here's why many comics are doing the exact same thing.

title.children: Why I'm proud to join the growing group of 'no show' comics pulling the plug on their festival shows

image.altText: Festival-goers at a music festival in Sydney.

props.synopsis: It is one of the big challenges of parenting; setting rules around alcohol with teenagers. Is it a good idea to give them a taste early? Is that even legal?

title.children: Can you give your underage teenager alcohol legally? This and other questions about youth drinking answered

image.altText: Three young boys pose for a photo on he beach at sunset.

props.synopsis: For the first time, some elders on Palm Island have had the chance to perform songs to the community as part of a project involving three generations.

title.children: 'Already built in us': Three generations sing at sunset Palm Island concert

image.altText: A close-up of an indigenous man with a painted face and his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: The Garma Festival is the best chance many Australians get to experience the rich culture of the Yolŋu, and the vibrant beauty of their land.

title.children: The Garma Festival is awash with opportunities for a photographer. These are our favourites

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Specific details of allegations against the Hawthorn Football Club have been outlined in court, with Indigenous ex-players claiming they were subjected to a "racist culture" and told to abandon plans to have families.

title.children: Court documents detail specific allegations from former players on club's 'racist culture'

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of Senator Linda Reynolds looking at the camera outside court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's legal team rejects claims Linda Reynolds's former staffer chose the senator to be the "villain" in her story of a political cover up.

title.children: 'I was angry': Linda Reynolds recounts night of Brittany Higgins, Bruce Lehrmann parliament breach

props.synopsis: Newly independent senator Fatima Payman has signalled she plans to use her bargaining power in the Senate to secure funding for local projects in exchange for her vote on contentious government legislation.

title.children: Don't count on my vote, Fatima Payman tells Labor, hinting at appetite to bargain

image.altText: Adelaide researcher Dr Michael Taylor has found legionella bacteria can live on their own

props.synopsis: Victorian health authorities are confident they have located and treated the source of a deadly legionnaires' outbreak in Melbourne.

title.children: Victorian health authorities confident they've 'identified and treated' source of legionnaires' outbreak

image.altText: A red Bendigo Bank sign.

props.synopsis: Accessing banking services in the Pacific is difficult, and it could soon become worse.

title.children: Australian banks are getting out of the Pacific. It threatens economies and livelihoods

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings after day 10 of the Olympic Games
